definition: Lasting for a very short time
cloze: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ___.

definition: Present, appearing, or found everywhere
cloze: Smartphones have become ___ in modern life.

definition: Carried out with minimal effort or reflection
cloze: He gave a ___ nod before walking away.

definition: A person who flatters someone important to gain advantage
cloze: The king was surrounded by ___ courtiers.

definition: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or action
cloze: The ___ negotiator refused every compromise.

definition: Having or showing great knowledge or learning
cloze: The professor gave an ___ lecture on medieval history.

definition: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way
cloze: The ___ influence of propaganda eroded public trust.

definition: Very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival
cloze: The winner was ___ in victory, praising her opponent.

definition: Reserved or uncommunicative in speech
cloze: The ___ farmer rarely spoke to strangers.

definition: Displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion
cloze: She stretched out in ___ repose under the willow tree.

definition: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude
cloze: The ___ student refused to follow classroom rules.

definition: Having a ready insight into and understanding of things
cloze: A ___ reader will notice the foreshadowing in chapter one.

definition: Optimistic or positive, especially in a difficult situation
cloze: Despite the setbacks, she remained ___ about the outcome.

definition: Filled with bitter criticism or malice
cloze: The editorial was ___ in its attack on the policy.

definition: Persisting tirelessly without showing signs of fatigue
cloze: The ___ campaigner knocked on every door in the district.

definition: Obedient or attentive to an excessive degree
cloze: The ___ waiter hovered over every table.

definition: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically
cloze: She took a ___ approach to solving the budget crisis.

definition: Open to more than one interpretation; ambiguous
cloze: His ___ response left everyone uncertain about his intentions.

definition: Angry and bitter in tone or manner
cloze: The divorce proceedings became increasingly ___.

definition: Unwilling or refusing to change one's views or agree
cloze: The ___ faction blocked every proposed amendment.

definition: Translucently clear in style or meaning
cloze: Her ___ prose made even complex ideas accessible.

definition: Impossible to understand or interpret
cloze: His ___ expression gave nothing away during the poker game.

definition: Recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources
cloze: The ___ spending of the regime bankrupted the treasury.

definition: Intended to teach, particularly in having moral instruction
cloze: The novel was too ___ to be enjoyable as fiction.

definition: Too great or extreme to be expressed in words
cloze: She felt an ___ joy at the birth of her child.

definition: Complaining in a petulant or whining manner
cloze: The ___ patient demanded attention every few minutes.

definition: Not telling the truth; lying
cloze: The witness gave a ___ account of the incident.

definition: Larger or more generous than is usual or necessary
cloze: The ___ donation funded the entire scholarship program.

definition: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant
cloze: The ___ debater challenged every point with hostility.

definition: Using very few words to express something
cloze: His ___ reply of 'no' ended the discussion.

definition: Indicating a good chance of success; favorable
cloze: The clear skies were ___ for the outdoor wedding.

definition: Vehement or clamorous in expressing opinions
cloze: The ___ crowd demanded the resignation of the official.

definition: Unwilling to spend money or use resources; stingy
cloze: The ___ landlord refused to fix the leaking roof.

definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior
cloze: The ___ weather made it impossible to plan ahead.

definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters
cloze: The ___ neighbor talked for an hour about nothing.

definition: To repeal or do away with a law, right, or formal agreement
cloze: The new government moved to ___ the outdated treaty.

definition: To criticize someone or something severely
cloze: The review ___ the film for its shallow characters.

definition: To cause someone to feel drained of energy or vitality
cloze: The oppressive heat seemed to ___ everyone in the room.

definition: To make something bad or unsatisfactory better
cloze: New policies were introduced to ___ working conditions.

definition: Free of anything that darkens; completely clear
cloze: The ___ waters of the mountain lake revealed every stone.

definition: Unable to be appeased or placated
cloze: She was an ___ opponent of corruption in government.

definition: Feeling or expressing remorse for wrongdoing
cloze: He offered a ___ apology for his hurtful remarks.

definition: Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence
cloze: The ___ artist rarely showed her paintings to anyone.

definition: To promote or make widely known an idea or cause
cloze: The organization worked to ___ awareness of climate change.

definition: Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical
cloze: His ___ plan to end world hunger in a year impressed no one.

definition: Poor; needy; lacking basic necessities
cloze: The shelter provided meals for ___ families in the area.

definition: Looking or sounding sad and dismal
cloze: The ___ melody filled the empty cathedral.

definition: Eager or quick to quarrel or fight
cloze: The ___ terrier barked at every passerby.

definition: Clear, logical, and convincing
cloze: She presented a ___ argument that swayed the jury.

definition: Extremely poor or unwilling to spend money
cloze: The ___ miser counted every coin before spending it.
